Transcription-Unit.comment:
dadAX operon expression is upregulated upon L-valine addition (isoleucine starvation) in the cellular growth medium [Gummesson20].

A potential RNA G-quadruplex structure, formed by guanine-rich sequences located in the coding sequence region of the gene, was identified for dadA. This structure could regulate the expression of the gene, as observed for hemL gene expression [Shao20].

Publication.title: Identification of the dadX gene coding for the predominant isozyme of alanine racemase in Escherichia coli K12.
Publication.author: Wild J
Hennig J
Lobocka M
Walczak W
Klopotowski T

Publication.title: Organization and expression of the Escherichia coli K-12 dad operon encoding the smaller subunit of D-amino acid dehydrogenase and the catabolic alanine racemase.
Publication.author: Lobocka M
Hennig J
Wild J
Klopotowski T

Evidence-Code.comment: Inferred through co-regulation. A transcription unit is inferred because a set of adjacent genes that are transcribed in the same direction exhibit similar expression patterns under a range of environmental conditions.

Evidence-Code.common-name: Products of adjacent genes in the same biological process
Evidence-Code.comment: A transcription unit is inferred because there is a set of adjacent genes, encoded in the same direction, coding for products that participate in the same metabolic pathway or biological process. Sometimes, these genes code for subunits of the same protein.

Promoter.comment: This is the +1 in induced cells; in uninduced cells transcription starts 5 bp dowstream: GATTAGA-(here). Several regions with significant similarity to known σ70 promoter sequences were found. Previous genetic studies identified a dadR gene as a cis-acting regulatory region of the dad operon. Therefore, the dadR region may contain promoter and regulatory sequences of the dad operon. The DNA fragment of about 260 bp preceding dadA should correspond to dadR.

Evidence-Code.comment: Automated inference. A computer inferred this assertion through one of many possible methods such as sequence similarity, recognized motifs or consensus sequence, etc. When a person made the inference from computational evidence, use EV-COMP-HINF.

Publication.title: Sigma70 promoters in Escherichia coli: specific transcription in dense regions of overlapping promoter-like signals.
Publication.author: Huerta AM
Collado-Vides J

Publication.title: Lrp is a direct repressor of the dad operon in Escherichia coli.
Publication.author: Mathew E
Zhi J
Freundlich M

Publication.title: Lrp binds to two regions in the dadAX promoter region of Escherichia coli to repress and activate transcription directly.
Publication.author: Zhi J
Mathew E
Freundlich M

Publication.title: In vitro and in vivo characterization of three major dadAX promoters in Escherichia coli that are regulated by cyclic AMP-CRP and Lrp.
Publication.author: Zhi J
Mathew E
Freundlich M

Evidence-Code.comment: The transcription start site is identified by primer extension.

A type of chromatin immunoprecipation evidence that uses high-throughput sequencing where immunoprecipitated DNA fragments are funnelled into a massively parallel sequencer to produce multiple short reads for locating binding sites of DNA-associated proteins. This evidence can be used to probe the binding of proteins, such as transcription factors or RNA polymerase, to DNA.

Publication.title: Escherichia coli Lrp Regulates One-Third of the Genome via Direct, Cooperative, and Indirect Routes.
Publication.author: Kroner GM
Wolfe MB
Freddolino PL

Evidence-Code.comment: A cis-mutation in the DNA sequence of the transcription-factor binding site interferes with the operation of the regulatory function. This is considered strong evidence for the existence and functional role of the DNA binding site.

Evidence-Code.common-name: A person inferred or reviewed a computer inference of sequence function based on similarity to a consensus sequence.
Evidence-Code.comment: Human inference based on similarity to consensus sequences

DNA-Binding-Site.comment: Changes in this site significantly altered dadAX expression.

Evidence-Code.common-name: Automated inference based on sequence pattern discovery
Evidence-Code.comment: A sequence found by pattern discovery using computational methods.

Publication.source: Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A 105(49);19462-7
Publication.title: Genome-scale reconstruction of the Lrp regulatory network in Escherichia coli.
Publication.author: Cho BK
Barrett CL
Knight EM
Park YS
Palsson BO

Evidence-Code.comment: A fixating agent such as formaldehyde is used to cross-link proteins and DNA. Sonication is applied for DNA shearing. For transcription factor tagging, a specific antibody or an epitope and its antibody are employed. After cross-linking is reversed, the DNA is amplified and labeled with a fluorophore for microarray, which produces a resolution of approximately 500 bp. This evidence can be used to probe the binding of proteins, such as transcription factors or RNA polymerase, to DNA.
